title: What is the foundational principle of the universal law that governs the universe, and how is it represented through numerical and symbolic systems?
first_phrase: In this text, the author explains the foundation of the universal law that governs the entire universe. It is based on the unity that multiplies itself by evolving from 1 to infinity through the symbol of multiplication, which is 0. By combining 1 and 0, the author explains how the numbers and the law of nature manifest symbolically in the universe. In the last 200 tokens, the author discusses the different graphical systems used to represent these concepts, including the Egyptian and Chaldean hieroglyphs and the Pythagorean numbers. The author also explains the proiective system, which is based on the projection of light and shadows. The text is intended to provide a theoretical basis for the novice to solve the alchemical problem and to understand the importance of the unity in the expression of magic and hieratic symbolism.

last_phrase: In conclusion, traditional graphic systems such as the jerogrammatic Egyptian and Chaldean, the Pitagorico of numbers and the Rabbinic of letters, have all been used to express ideas through symbols. While their scientific basis is debatable, their practical application can only be taught through empirical practice. The proiettivo system is among the most commonly used, and its simplicity lies in projecting shadows and expressing them through lines and curves. Understanding and using these graphic symbols can open up a world of hidden meanings and reflections of the soul.
